result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd w/ Minor Pass. < 16 yrs.)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony James Thomas Helt

records.addlTxt:
11:34 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony James Thomas Helt in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 11:45 am.

1:22 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anthony James Thomas Helt appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State recommends a $200.00 cash. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders  a $200.00 cash. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.
